crypto.name: Cascader
crypto.desc:
Just found this super cool key exchange protocol while scrolling Hacker News between meetings ☕️⚡️🧠

It's based on some clean recurrence math — none of that dinosaur-era number theory stuff 🦕 finally, crypto that doesn't look like it was invented in the 70s 📟

It came with a working implementation too, so i plugged it right in and shipped to prod 🚀🛠️

A few people said I should’ve used something more “proven” 🔒🤷‍♂️ but honestly... this just feels right ✨

Anyway, i packaged it into a challenge. Curious to see what the skeptics say now 😏🔍

crypto.name: Crypto
crypto.desc: These keys look completely different, yet they have something in common...

crypto.name: Days of Yore
crypto.desc:
Long before cryptography became a playground of prime numbers and elliptic curves, it was more like a craft project 🎨. People would shuffle letters, invent quirky alphabets, or scribble secret notes that only their friends could read. It was messy, creative, and surprisingly fun.

This challenge is a little trip back to that era. What you’re staring at once began as a few plain paragraphs of English text 📖. Nothing fancy, just words on a page. But now those words carry a secret, tucked away like a treasure waiting to be found 🏴.

Unfortunately, the encryption/decryption key is forever lost, hope that's not too much of an inconvenience...

Can you put yourself in the shoes of an old-school codebreaker and bring the hidden message back to life?

crypto.name: Free Candy
crypto.desc: Woah, free candy... sign me up!

crypto.name: Prime Genes
crypto.desc: Found a new cool way to generate prime numbers, let's check it out. 🧬 🧪

misc.name: Hard Rock
misc.desc:
Such an Ohio-core song, giving sigma rizz to a lore-drop nobody asked for.

Flag format: FORTID{...}

misc.name: Meta 2.0
misc.desc: Data science is old news, kids today are all about metadata science...

misc.name: Misc
misc.desc:
Beginner OSINT Stego
This picture seems oddly familiar… but something about it feels ever so slightly off.

misc.name: OSINT Exam
misc.desc:
OSINT
Can you pass our OSINT certification exam?

pwn.name: Deja vu
pwn.desc:
Stumbled upon C++ recently, still learning the ropes...

This time I can't even keep my program from crashing 💥

pwn.name: Leaky Key Management
pwn.desc: Our key management system might be leaking 🔑💦

pwn.name: Michael Scofield
pwn.desc:
T-Bag: "You think you’re the smartest man in the room?"

Michael: "No. But I don’t need to be. I just need to be the one with the plan."

Flag is in flag.txt.

pwn.name: Protect the Environment
pwn.desc: Protect the earth? We can't even protect our environment variables...

pwn.name: Pwn
pwn.desc: Stumbled upon Rust recently, still learning the ropes...

pwn.name: Reverse Polish Pwn
pwn.desc: Try our advanced command line calculator...

rev.name: First Steps
rev.desc:
Kids today start learning programming using Python 🐍 and AI 🤖. However, the cool kids of the last millennium bossed around a tiny turtle in Logo 🐢💾.

Can you figure out how to satisfy this old-school flag checker?

Note: once you figure out the secret digits, wrap them in FortID{} before submitting.

rev.name: Rev
rev.desc: In order to find the flag, you must first search for the flag.

rev.name: Rev From the Past
rev.desc:
Last year you've enjoyed pwning a binary from the MS-DOS era.

This year, we challenge you to reverse engineer one such binary.

web.name: EUD A I
web.desc:
0/25 attempts

I've been working on an EUDI showcase which I'll present at the next big conference. 🇪🇺

Basically, I've taken the Architecture and Reference Framework and fed it to a popular LLM 🙈

I repeatedly asked the LLM to summarize the standards until it spit out something I could finally understand. The LLM's implementation should be secure... If you want to convince me it isn't, find Bill Roscoe's flag! 🚩

Note: To prevent you from guessing the flag, you'll have only 25 submissions available, use them wisely. The flag format is FortID{<32_hex_characters>}

web.name: Jey is not my son
web.desc: Find the year the flag was created, that’s the answer you seek. But beware: Jey is not not my son.

web.name: Web
web.desc: In tangled webs of code we weave, JavaScript whispers, making pages breathe, Turning static dreams into worlds that live.
